When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)

title: This is a test of a python notebook
text:
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

We will display a random plot below

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: RADISH 2023
text:
A cute radish


The Reproducibility, Accessibility, Documentation and Inter-operability Standards Hackathon (RADISH23), organised by Bob Verity, Shazia Ruybal, Bryan Greenhouse and Amy Wesolowski will take place on Mon 11th Dec to Thurs 14th Dec 2023 in Baltimore, USA.

title: RADISH 2023
text:
A cute radish


The Reproducibility, Accessibility, Documentation and Inter-operability Standards Hackathon (RADISH23), organised by Bob Verity, Shazia Ruybal, Bryan Greenhouse and Amy Wesolowski will take place on Mon 11th Dec to Thurs 14th Dec 2023 in Baltimore, USA.

title: RADISH 2023
text:
Main aims
Our aim to take the wide range of software tools in malaria genomic epidemiology and make it so that more people can use them more reliably. This is a first step in working towards more ambitious goals like designing workflows, benchmarking, or coming up with guidelines for best practices.

title: RADISH 2023
text:
Tutorial development
Take a look at the tutorial guidelines for more details.

title: Tutorials overview
text:
Some details of the various tutorials and the types of tools, eg simulation, analysis etc
Note: we can create a ‘listing’ of all tutorials, more details here
For now, in the Tests menu option we have a test R markdown (.rmd) and a Python notebook (.ipynb) for demonstration purposes.

title: Tutorials overview
text:

Note: we can create a ‘listing’ of all tutorials, more details here
For now, in the Tests menu option we have a test R markdown (.rmd) and a Python notebook (.ipynb) for demonstration purposes.

title: PGEforge
text: PGEforge is a community-built resource for enhancing common software tools in Plasmodium genomic epidemiology with tutorials and analysis workflows.

title: PGEforge
text: PGEforge is a community-built resource for enhancing common software tools in Plasmodium genomic epidemiology with tutorials and analysis workflows.

title: PGEforge
text:
A community-led effort
Most of these resources were developed at the RADISH23 Hackathon by the following contributors.
